content.description: Climb up to the jug under the roof, pop up to the jug above the roof and pull yourself to the top. This will probably be a full on dyno for short people. A static version is possible too but, it is a grade or two harder.
content.location: On the west side of the rock band at the top of the ridge. Look for the roof above a dihedral. If you find Prime Cut you've gone too far.

content.description: After crawling back as far as you can go into the crevasse, you will near the smaller exit hole. Start here by lying on your back with double hand jams. Kick your feet up into the crack ahead of you and make the tight invert transition in the less than ideal space. Starting this far back provides the most obvious/bomber start holds, but can be trickier for the taller person.
content.location: Park at the First Pigtail Boulders and hike up the road 100 yards. Here there will be a forest access road on the left hand side (east) of the paved road. Turn left (east) down this access road and see the large blocky rock formation found on the right hand side of the access road atop the hill. Trend off the access road heading towards the blocky rock formation. Pass by the right (southeast) side of this formation and one other behind it, following up the gully until coming into sight of Boaring Ridge. You will see the wide right trending crack split of Prime Cut.

content.description: A ridge with several bands of rock running roughly north-south. The first is visible from the road. Doesn't look like much, but there are some gems in there.
